22  import junit.framework.TestCase;
23  import org.apache.archiva.redback.components.cache.Cache;
24  import org.apache.archiva.redback.components.cache.CacheStatistics;
25  import org.apache.archiva.redback.components.cache.CacheException;
26  import org.apache.archiva.redback.components.cache.factory.CacheFactory;
27  import org.apache.archiva.redback.components.cache.test.examples.wine.Wine;
28  import org.junit.Before;
29  import org.junit.Test;
30  import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
31  import org.springframework.test.context.ContextConfiguration;
32  import org.springframework.test.context.junit4.SpringJUnit4ClassRunner;
33  
34  import java.util.ArrayList;
35  import java.util.Iterator;
36  import java.util.List;
37  import java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler;
38  import java.util.logging.Level;
39  import java.util.logging.Logger;

41  /**
42   * AbstractCacheTestCase 
43   *
44   * @author <a href="mailto:joakim@erdfelt.com">Joakim Erdfelt</a>
45   *
46   */
47  @RunWith( SpringJUnit4ClassRunner.class )
48  @ContextConfiguration( locations = {"classpath*:/META-INF/spring-context.xml","classpath*:/spring-context.xml"} )
49  public abstract class AbstractCacheTestCase
50      extends TestCase
51  {
52      static
53      {
54          Logger logger = Logger.getLogger( "org.codehaus.plexus.cache" );
55          logger.setLevel( Level.ALL );
56          ConsoleHandler handler = new ConsoleHandler();
57          handler.setLevel( Level.ALL );
58          logger.addHandler( handler );
59      }
60      
61      protected Cache<String,Integer> cache;
62  
63      @Before
64      public void setUp()
65          throws Exception
66      {
67          super.setUp();
68          cache = getCache();
69      }
70  
71  
72      public abstract Cache<String,Integer> getCache();
73  
74      @Test
75      public void testSimplePutGet()
76      {
77          Integer fooInt = Integer.valueOf( 42 );
78          cache.put( "foo", fooInt );
79  
80          Integer val = cache.get( "foo" );
81          assertEquals( 42, val.intValue() );
82  
83          assertNull( cache.get( "bar" ) );
84      }
85  
86      @Test
87      public void testLargePutGet()
88      {
89          EnglishNumberFormat fmt = new EnglishNumberFormat();
90  
91          for ( int i = 4500; i <= 5000; i++ )
92          {
93              String key = fmt.toText( i );
94              cache.put( key, Integer.valueOf( i ) );
95          }
96  
97          // Put some holes into the list.
98          List<String> removedKeys = new ArrayList<String>();
99          removedKeys.add( fmt.toText( 4600 ) );
100         removedKeys.add( fmt.toText( 4700 ) );
101         removedKeys.add( fmt.toText( 4800 ) );
102 
103         Iterator<String> it = removedKeys.iterator();
104         while ( it.hasNext() )
105         {
106             cache.remove( it.next() );
107         }
108 
109         // Some direct gets
110         assertEquals( Integer.valueOf( 4590 ), cache.get( "four thousand five hundred ninety" ) );
111         assertEquals( Integer.valueOf( 4912 ), cache.get( "four thousand nine hundred twelve" ) );
112         int DIRECT = 2;
113 
114         // Fetch the list repeatedly
115         int ITERS = 100;
116         int LOW = 4590;
117         int HIGH = 4810;
118         for ( int iter = 0; iter < ITERS; iter++ )
119         {
120             for ( int num = LOW; num < HIGH; num++ )
121             {
122                 String key = fmt.toText( num );
123                 Integer expected = Integer.valueOf( num );
124                 Integer val = cache.get( key );
125 
126                 // Intentionally removed entries?
127                 if ( removedKeys.contains( key ) )
128                 {
129                     assertNull( "Removed key [" + key + "] should have no value.", val );
130                 }
131                 else
132                 {
133                     assertEquals( expected, val );
134                 }
135             }
136         }
137 
138         // Test the statistics.
139         CacheStatistics stats = cache.getStatistics();
140 
141         int expectedHits = ( ( ( HIGH - LOW - removedKeys.size() ) * ITERS ) + DIRECT );
142         int expectedMiss = ( ITERS * removedKeys.size() );
143 
144         /* Due to the nature of how the various providers do their work, the expected values
145          * should be viewed as minimum values, not exact values.
146          */
147         assertTrue( "Cache hit count should exceed [" + expectedHits + "], but was actually [" + stats.getCacheHits()
148             + "]", expectedHits <= stats.getCacheHits() );
149 
150         assertTrue( "Cache miss count should exceed [" + expectedMiss + "], but was actually [" + stats.getCacheMiss()
151             + "]", expectedMiss <= stats.getCacheMiss() );
152 
153         /* For the same reason as above, the hit rate is completely un-testable.
154          * Leaving this commented so that future developers understand the reason we are not
155          * testing this value.
156          
157          double expectedHitRate = (double) expectedHits / (double) ( expectedHits + expectedMiss );
158          assertTrue( "Cache hit rate should exceed [" + expectedHitRate + "], but was actually ["
159          + stats.getCacheHitRate() + "]", expectedHitRate <= stats.getCacheHitRate() );
160          
161          */
162     }
163 
164     public abstract Cache<String,Wine> getAlwaysRefresCache()
165         throws Exception;
166 
167     @Test
168     public void testAlwaysRefresh()
169         throws Exception
170     {
171         Wine wine = new Wine( "bordeaux", "west/south of France" );
172         String key = wine.getName();
173         Cache<String,Wine> cache = this.getAlwaysRefresCache();
174         cache.put( key, wine );
175         assertNull( cache.get( key ) );
176     }
177 
178     public abstract Cache<String,Wine> getNeverRefresCache()
179         throws Exception;
180 
181     @Test
182     public void testNeverRefresh()
183         throws Exception
184     {
185         Cache<String,Wine> cache = this.getNeverRefresCache();
186         Wine wine = new Wine( "bordeaux", "west/south of France" );
187         String key = wine.getName();
188         cache.put( key, wine );
189         //Thread.sleep( 1200 );
190         Wine o = cache.get( key );
191         assertNotNull( o );
192         assertEquals( wine.hashCode(), o.hashCode() );
193     }
194 
195     public abstract Cache<String,Wine> getOneSecondRefresCache()
196         throws Exception;
197 
198     @Test
199     public void testOneSecondRefresh()
200         throws Exception
201     {
202         Cache<String,Wine> cache = this.getOneSecondRefresCache();
203         Wine wine = new Wine( "bordeaux", "west/south of France" );
204         String key = wine.getName();
205         cache.put( key, wine );
206         Thread.sleep( 1200 );
207         assertNull( cache.get( key ) );
208     }
209 
210     public abstract Cache<String,Wine> getTwoSecondRefresCache()
211         throws Exception;
212 
213     @Test
214     public void testTwoSecondRefresh()
215         throws Exception
216     {
217         Cache<String,Wine> cache = this.getTwoSecondRefresCache();
218         Wine wine = new Wine( "bordeaux", "west/south of France" );
219         String key = wine.getName();
220         cache.put( key, wine );
221         Thread.sleep( 500 );
222         Wine o = cache.get( key );
223         assertNotNull( o );
224         assertEquals( wine.hashCode(), o.hashCode() );
225     }
226 
227     public abstract Class getCacheClass();
228 
229     @Test
230     public void testCacheFactory() throws CacheException
231     {
232         Cache<String,Integer> cache = CacheFactory.getInstance().getCache( "foo-factory-test", null );
233 
234         // This test is only here to ensure that the provider implements a Creator class.
235         assertNotNull( "Cache should not be null", cache );
236         assertEquals( "Cache class", getCacheClass().getName(), cache.getClass().getName() );
237         assertTrue( "Cache should be assignable from", getCacheClass().isAssignableFrom( cache.getClass() ) );
238         
239         // Now do some basic set/get functions to test if the cache has been initialized (or not).
240         assertNull( cache.get( "bad wolf" ) );
241         
242         Integer fooInt = Integer.valueOf( 42 );
243         cache.put( "foo", fooInt );
244 
245         Integer val = cache.get( "foo" );
246         assertEquals( 42, val.intValue() );
247 
248         assertNull( cache.get( "bar" ) );
249     }
